messages: a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (07:33): ping: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:35): hey
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (07:40): hey 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e - do you know, or know someone who knows, or know somewhere I can find out information about youtube.com/html5 ?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:41): what information?
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (07:41): HTTP requisites
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:41): not sure what you mean
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (07:41): I'm getting 403 on my experimental build of webkit
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:41): odd
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (07:41): so presumably there are requisite headers
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:41): 403 for the video file?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:42): and it works for regular webkit?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:42): how weird
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:42): have you dumped the two network traffic sessions and compared them?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:42): i don't see why there'd be anything like that
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (07:42): this is a different multimedia backend
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:43): i'd recommend cracking out tcpdump and comparing them
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (07:44): my thought is it's probably either a cookie it wants, or a missing refferer header
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (07:44): my backend passes on neither at the moment
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (07:45): anyway, I just thought you might have seen some documents floating around I could consult :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:46): oh you almost certainly need the opt-in cookie
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (07:50): yeah, unfortunately the webkit interface for media is somewhat broken in this respect. The backend is only passed a URL to the media file.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:52): seriously, i'd recommend using tcpdump to see what the working UA is sending
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:52): it could be something obvious

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:52): a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5: we do want to eventually fix the networking to go through WebKit's http stick - just tricky to beat both WebKit and relevant media engines into shape
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:52): a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5: I think Referer or Cookie is a likely candidate

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:53): a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5: if you find the differences, one easy way to see which is making the difference could be to use curl or wget with custom headers
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (07:55): unfortunately I'm on linux atm, and HTML5 media support is in chrome (but not chromium) afaik
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (07:55): which leaves me with nothing to compare against
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (07:56): but a massive wget hack could work :P
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:07): there's no official Chrome for Linux yet?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:07): wait, WebKit/Gtk has video support - does that not work?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:07): (or is that what you are working on now?)
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (08:08): I'm working on WebKit/Qt

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:08): you could check if WebKit/Gtk can handle YouTube, that might be the easiest point of reference (though of course you'd need a GStreamer module that does H.264...)
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (08:09): yeah.. I have that
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (08:09): I'll investigate :)
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (08:11): also, it looks like there is an official chrome for linux now
a13dd189d82538a3cf8f8e47d3b133a5 (08:28): dear lord, the GTK version explicitly spoofs its user agent for movies.apple.com
